abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column submits that Senate proposal to designate electricity from burning forests as carbon neutral and renewable energy source could be even greater danger to Pres Obama's Clean Power Plan than legal challenges and climate change deniers; notes if proposal become law, energy policy analysts predict average 64 million tons of greenhouse gas will be added to air yearly.

headline.print_headline: Concern Grows as Senate Allies Argue Biomass Is ‘Neutral’ Fuel
headline.main: Next ‘Renewable Energy’: Burning Forests, if Senators Get Their Way

snippet: The president’s Clean Power Plan is being fought by 28 states, and a bipartisan group of senators who want burning wood for electricity to be considered carbon neutral....
lead_paragraph: The president’s Clean Power Plan is being fought by 28 states, and a bipartisan group of senators who want burning wood for electricity to be considered carbon neutral.
